node.title: Six new COVID-19 cases reported in SA as exposure sites linked with former premier announced
node.alt: A beach foreshore with lawn, buildings and palm trees
node.description: Six new COVID-19 cases are reported in South Australia, including one whose source is being investigated. SA Health also lists six new exposure sites in the Adelaide CBD and Glenelg.
node.content:
["Six new COVID-19 cases have been reported in South Australia, including one whose source is being investigated.", "SA Health says two of the cases were acquired interstate, two locally \u2014 both in the Norwood cluster \u2014 and one overseas.", "It is still investigating where the sixth case has come from.", "SA Health on Saturday night\u00a0named six new COVID-19 exposure sites and updated four, including two connected with former premier Jay Weatherill, six days after he visited them.", "Mr Weatherill tested positive for the virus on Wednesday after going to the\u00a0Henley High School reunion that sparked the Norwood cluster\u00a0last Saturday.", "He was visiting Adelaide as part of a multi-state tour promoting\u00a0early childhood development\u00a0as the chief executive of the Thrive by Five foundation.", "A Thrive by Five event he hosted at the Stamford Grand hotel in Glenelg on Monday evening was listed as a close contact exposure location by SA Health last night, while two visits to the Parlamento Italian restaurant opposite Parliament House were listed as casual contact exposure locations.", "", "
Former SA premier Jay Weatherill meets with Opposition Leader Peter Malinauskas and former deputy premier John Rau at Parlamento restaurant on Monday.(Twitter: SA Liberal Media)
", "Mr Weatherill \u2014 who is now residing in Perth \u2014 was photographed at the restaurant last Monday with Opposition Leader Peter Malinauskas and former deputy premier John Rau.", "Chief Public Health Officer Nicola Spurrier yesterday said the new hierarchy of exposure sites brought in two weeks ago \u2014 where some do not require those who attended to quarantine \u2014 took longer to process than before.", "\"To get the information that is more [complete],\u00a0so that we're giving people the better advice about the quarantine time and who needs to quarantine, it does take that little bit longer to pull all of that information together,\" she said.", "The updated exposure sites include upgrading the Thai Orchid restaurant in Henley Beach from a casual contact location to a close contact exposure location, meaning those who had dinner there on Tuesday night will have to spend at least seven days in quarantine rather than just get tested.", "The date of Parisi's restaurant in Hyde Park as an exposure site was changed from November 29 to November 30.", "Other new or updated exposure sites include Asian Gourmet at the Central Market, Ayla's Cafe, Xpress Personal Training and Ying Chow Chinese Restaurant in Adelaide's CBD, the Fourth wine bar in Glenelg, and the Fox and Firkin British Pub in Tea Tree Gully.", "The South Australian government yesterday announced all travellers from NSW, Victoria and the ACT would have to be\u00a0tested for COVID-19 and isolate until they got their\u00a0results.", "From this morning, all Adelaide residents travelling to Queensland will have to quarantine for 14 days.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
